Name: Deathwatch
Rules: Special Issue Ammunition!Once per turning point, when a friendly DEATHWATCH operative is performing the Shoot action, in the Select Weapon step, you can use this rule. If you do, select one of the following weapon rules for that operative�s ranged weapons to have until the end of the action. This rule cannot be used with explosive grenades (see universal equipment) or melta bombs: Blast 1;Devastating 1;Lethal 5+;Piercing 1;Rending;Saturate;Severe

Ploys.Name: SUFFER NOT THE ALIEN
Ploys.Content: Use this firefight ploy after rolling your attack dice for a friendly DEATHWATCH operative, if it�s shooting against or fighting against an operative that doesn�t have the CHAOS or IMPERIUM keyword. You can re-roll any of your attack dice.

Faction_equipment: DIGITAL WEAPONS!Once per turning point, when a friendly DEATHWATCH operative performs the Fight action, at the start of the Roll Attack Dice step, you can use this rule. If you do, inflict 1 damage on the enemy operative in that sequence.

Name: Kasrkin
Rules: Skill at Arms!STRATEGIC GAMBIT. Select a SKILL AT ARMS for friendly KASRKIN operatives to have until the Ready step of the next Strategy phase.

Ploys.Name: ELIMINATION PATTERN
Ploys.Content: Whenever a friendly KASRKIN operative is shooting with a hot-shot weapon against an operative that’s not in cover or is being scanned (see RECON-TROOPER), that weapon has the Piercing Crits 1 weapon rule, or Piercing 1 instead if it’s a hot-shot volley gun.

Ploys.Name: SEIZE THE INITIATIVE
Ploys.Content: Use this firefight ploy at the start of the Firefight phase. One friendly KASRKIN operative can immediately perform a 1AP action for free, but it cannot move during that action. You cannot use this ploy if you’re the player with initiative.

Faction_equipment: FOREGRIP!Whenever a friendly KASRKIN operative is shooting an operative within 3" of it, ranged weapons on its datacard (excluding weapons that include ‘pistol’ in their name, e.g. hot-shot laspistol, all profiles of a plasma pistol, etc.) have the Accurate 1 weapon rule.
